oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from James B. Owen to his father
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Four-page letter on intersting military stationary from Pvt. James B. Owen, Co. D, 31st Ill. Inf. Regt., USA to his father. He writes there is little news except that the weather is beautiful and he is well and things; are going well for their army. They have used the lake to their advantage to get below Vicksburg. Owen was from Brownsville, Ill. and died Sept. 3, 1863.
